JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;Elisabeth Steiner;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the town of LOC in LOC .
CARDINAL . Late in the evening of DATE the applicant was arrested at his home on suspicion of having committed theft and robbery . He was placed in the isolation wing of the LOC police station .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , in response to his requests for legal aid , he was beaten up by police officers PERSON and PERSON They pressurised him to confess to the above - mentioned crimes . The applicant attempted to commit suicide but , as it appears , was promptly provided with medical assistance . It does not appear that this incident had any adverse consequences on his health .
CARDINAL . Following the arrest the applicant remained in detention .
CARDINAL . The Government submitted that according to the information provided by ORG of GPE the applicant 's first documented interview took place on DATE in the presence of his lawyer , S.
CARDINAL . The applicant complained about the ill - treatment to the police and to a local prosecutor 's office .

CARDINAL . It appears that the prosecutor 's office did not take any steps in connection with the applicant 's complaints , other than remitting the case to a police investigator , PERSON , from the same police station .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON ordered the applicant 's medical examination .

CARDINAL . The examination was carried out on DATE . According to the expert 's report , the applicant had a bruise of QUANTITY on his back in the right lumbar region and the right temple area was sensitive on palpation . Noting that no harm to the applicant 's health could be established , the expert concluded that the bruise could have been inflicted at the time and in the circumstances described by the applicant .
CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE a senior assistant to ORG refused to institute criminal proceedings against police officers PERSON and PERSON for lack of evidence of a crime .

CARDINAL . The decision referred to the statements of PERSON and PERSON , who denied the allegations of ill - treatment . Investigator PERSON stated that he had ordered a medical examination in response to the applicant 's complaint and noted that the applicant had not complained about the alleged ill - treatment to the prosecutor when the latter had authorised his detention on remand . Finally , having regard to the expert 's report , the prosecutor concluded that he was unable to establish any ill - treatment on the part of the police officers and noted that the injury sustained by the applicant could have occurred “ in other circumstances ” .
CARDINAL . The applicant submitted that he had learned about this decision “ much later ” .
CARDINAL . The Government did not make any comments concerning the date of notification of this decision to the applicant .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant 's criminal case concerning the charges of theft and robbery was transferred to ORG for examination .

CARDINAL . During the court hearing of his criminal case on DATE the applicant repeated his allegations of ill - treatment . The CARDINAL co - accused in the applicant 's case also alleged ill - treatment by the police officers . The prosecutor participating in the examination of the case moved to adjourn the proceedings in order to carry out an inquiry into their submissions .
CARDINAL . By a decision of the same date the trial court entrusted ORG with the inquiry and adjourned the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Senior Assistant to the Prosecutor of ORG refused to institute criminal proceedings against the police officers , referring , among other things , to the oral evidence given by police officers PERSON and PERSON and investigator PERSON as well as to the previous decision of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicant stated that he was not notified about the decision immediately .
CARDINAL . The Government submitted that the decision had been read aloud during the court hearing of DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant complained about the decisions of the prosecutor 's office to ORG , alleging that they were unfounded and that several witnesses of the ill - treatment had not been questioned , and requested an additional inquiry .
CARDINAL . By a judgment of DATE the court rejected his complaint . In particular , it stated that :

“ ... The plaintiff 's submissions proved unconfirmed during the court hearing . According to the statements of the police officers PERSON and PERSON obtained in course of the prosecutor 's inquiry into the alleged ill - treatment , PERSON [ the applicant ] was detained on suspicion of robbery and theft , no physical or psychological pressure was exerted on him ... PERSON failed to complain to the prosecutor who ... authorised his arrest although he had the opportunity ...
... According to the plaintiff , upon his placement in the isolation ward , he was hit with his head against the walls . However , his co - accused ORG . did not confirm this allegation .

The expert 's opinion of DATE revealed an injury , [ namely , ] a bruise in the left lumbar region . No injuries to the head were established ... which refutes the [ plaintiff 's ] allegations of ill - treatment following his arrest .

In these circumstances the court considers that the decisions [ ... ] of [ ... ] DATE refusing to institute criminal proceedings against PERSON and PERSON and [ ... ] of DATE [ ... ] are lawful and that there are no reasons to quash them . ”
CARDINAL . The applicant appealed .

CARDINAL . By a decision of DATE ORG held that the trial court had examined the case under the rules of civil procedure whereas the complaints against the investigative measures ought to have been examined under the provisions of the criminal procedure . It quashed the first - instance judgment and terminated the proceedings without examining the substance of the applicant 's complaints .

CARDINAL . NORP In response to the ORG 's request for copies of the investigation file in respect of the events of DATE , the Government submitted that the file had been destroyed due to the expiry of the time - limit for its storage . The Government referred to an ORG dated DATE issued by ORG office .

CARDINAL . By a judgment of DATE the ORG convicted the applicant of robbery and theft and sentenced him to DATE of imprisonment and confiscation of his property . The applicant submits that he received a copy of the judgment on DATE . In the judgment , the trial court specifically rejected the applicant 's allegations of ill - treatment as unfounded without contesting the existence of his injuries or providing any explanation for their origin . The trial court referred to the decision of CARDINAL DATE without questioning the witnesses mentioned in that decision in court .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment on appeal .
CARDINAL . Both courts referred to the conclusions of the prosecutor 's inquiries into the alleged ill - treatment and rejected the applicant 's submissions in this connection .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( f ) of LAW of the Russian Federation makes acts of torture punishable by DATE imprisonment . Under LAW ( a ) and ( c ) abuse of an official position associated with the use of violence or entailing serious consequences carries a punishment of DATE imprisonment .

CARDINAL . DATE , criminal proceedings in GPE were governed by LAW RSFSR ( “ the old ORG ” ) . Under LAW ORG , a refusal to open criminal proceedings could be appealed against to a prosecutor or a court . Under LAW , a refusal by the prosecutor could be appealed against to a higher prosecutor .
